description:
I love gelato and love the variety of fruity flavors they have including some really ones like guava, dragon fruit, sapose! 

They have a pretty extensive menu outside of the range of gelato flavors too! 

Good location, normal prices, yum!
author: Aria S.

description:
What better place to visit after a nice round of indoor mini-golf?  La Copa Loca for sure.  Small as it may be, the little store more than makes up with excellent service, love, and of course, the icy treats.  The neighborhood gelateria is home to some of the most mesmerizing gelatos around.  One such example is the flamboyant  dragonfruit.  

The problem?  Too many flavors to choose from!  Sampling alone took a little while, not to mention picking out a flavor or two from the mix.  Ended up going with quanabana and pistachio.  Both were creamy, smooth, distinct, and left us desiring for more.  

The spot to go for that perfect ending to the evening (or just about any time).
author: Ken L.

description:
Good gelato with surprisingly interesting flavors. East-coasters - this is nowhere near as rich & creamy as the best spots in NYC, but might be as good as we can get in SF!

I tried:
* Goat cheese figs
* Walnut
I'd give 3 stars. Flavors not the most authentic, but fine. Texture could be more rich & smooth.

I got:
* Honey thyme
* Chocolate hazelnut "gianduia"
I pretty much can never dislike chocolate hazelnut. This was a nice combo, and I surprisingly enjoyed the Honey Thyme. Again, texture could be more smooth, but this did the job for our cold treats craving.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
It just so happens that I have a weekly meeting near La Copa Loca, so I've gotten a chance to sample their great gelato and sorbet over the past few months. What I find unique about this place is that they carry tropical flavors such as coconut, tamarind, and soursop, and overall, they do a great job in terms of texture and flavor. 

I tend to like tart flavors, so I was pleased that their tamarind sorbet was sour but with enough sweetness to make its tartness not be overpowering. I also like their pineapple sorbet, and you can sample several flavors if you need help making a choice. I tried their Piña Colada shake (which combines pineapple sorbet and coconut sherbet) during my most recent visit, and while I liked the combined flavors of the shake, the whipped cream that I added did not taste sweet to me. I'm not sure if the sweetness of the shake overpowered the whipped cream, but the whipped cream just seemed bland. 

During the late afternoon, this place seems to be a popular spot for children/teens, but I find that the line moves relatively quickly.
author: Keith H.

description:
This place has not caught on with the latest group of gentrifiers in the Mission. I'm happy because it means no lines and no annoying conversations to listen to. Let them wait in line at Humphry Slocombes or Smittens. 

The owner is an Italian, which most do not realize since it is not mentioned on the website and the name is in Spanish, who was at one point the Corporate Executive Chef at Pasta Pomodoros. This guy lives and breathes Gelato now and takes it very seriously. I first found out about La Copa Loca from a billionaire in Los Angeles who vacations yearly in Italy. He noted La Copa Loca was run by a talented Gelato maker from Italy-- we both agreed the name was odd but... I can say as a fellow Italian that this place rivals anything I have had in Rome, Milan, Naples, or Florence. 

I've been coming here since it opened. I've also been all over Italy stopping in every Gelato place I walked by. This place is the real deal people even though it is marketed towards the local Mexican people, it is pure breed Italian. Anyone saying it needs more cream is Gelato illiterate. Go get some ice cream. 

While some of the flavors and concoctions may not be up to American standards in sweetness, if you stick to the originals you will not be disappointed as long as you know what Gelato is. Personally over the last ten or fifteen years of coming here, I have only ever purchased chocolate, hazelnut, and limon. Never been disappointed and have no desire to go anywhere else.
author: H K.

description:
Cool little gelato shop on 22nd street in the Mission. Wanted to try something "different" as I tend to do so I narrowed it down between the Dragonfruit and the Vanilla Mexico superior (gluten free). 

I tried both and was pretty torn between each but I appreciate the friendly service and they even encouraged me to try other flavors. 

I ended up going with the Vanilla Mexico and it was pretty good but not amazing by any means. 

Nice spot in the Mission to hit your Gelato cravings..

So many good ice cream/gelato/chocolate spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 

I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them.

author: Rod M.

description: I'm really disappointed with La Copa Loca. I remember it being so much more delicious and authentic than what I recently tasted. This time around, I could not find a flavor I enjoyed. All the fruit flavor options I sampled tasted very perfumy, but almost flavorless. The texture was not silky like you expect gelato to be, rather it was very icy. There's a possibility I chose the wrong flavors, however, I do not think I will be back to test this theory.
author: Adriana G.

description:
Living La Copa Loca! 

With San Francisco's steady temperatures, I find myself wanting something cool and refreshing quite often; especially during winters at 72° weather, sorbet is most definitely in order. 

At La Copa Loca, they offer a huge variety of both sorbets and ice cream, specialty flavors at that. They have a bunch of exotic selections which rotate seasonally. 

Prices are beyond fair, usually under $5. 

Very small seating area and lines can get long, but they do move quick. 

Great ice cream parlor in the Mission District!
author: Ann S.

description:
Was looking for a quick dessert spot after dinner. La Copa Loca came up as the nearest location - and it was the perfect choice. 

SO MANY fun tropical/exotic fruit flavors + your standard favs! Not gonna lie, tried a few of the tropical flavs (for future reference of course), but ended up w the standard mint choco chip and pistachio (BOTH DELISH). 

They have everything ranging frm passion fruit to dragon fruit to tamarind - all the way back to choco hazelnut and vanilla. IMO, they were are velvety and packed with flavor. The best kind of gelato you could as for! 

Would def return for another visit to try out some more flavors. 5 stars!
author: Jennifer L.

description: So good! Ordered child scoops of both gluten free pistachio and rum & raisin gelato in a hazelnut cone. They're locally owned and also serve smoothies, sorbet and crepes. Clean and very friendly too!
author: Gena H.

description:
La Copa Loca offers quite a vast menu for a small shop: They make sundaes with a combination of fruit, crepes, shakes, smoothies, gelato cakes, a variety of cones and specials like fruit filled with sorbet! They specialize in many tropical and Latin American fruit sorbets, which differentiates them from other ice cream stores.

Dragonfruit sorbet is excellent. Passion fruit sorbet and coconut gelato are also very good. I tried about ten sorbet flavors, which was very nice and patient of the counter person. Many were too sweet. I would return to try a crepe and other gelati. Visit when you're in the area!
author: Carol W.

description: This is a cute little hole-in-the wall gelato/ice cream joint in the Mission district of SF. I never heard of this place, but was taken here because my friend at the time went here years ago and wondered if it was still around. Our visit here was perfect in that we were waiting for our reservation at El Techo, so we were able to kill some time and eat dessert before dinner. They have a ton of really good flavors and we tried a bunch, especially the tropical flavors were our favorite. We settled with a cup of the melon & cup of the dragonfruit sorbet. This place is also prob one of the more affordable and under the radar spots as a cup was about $3-$4. They have little benches & a seating area outside which is where we sat to people watch & enjoy the evening heat. Don't think this place has gotten too much media attention and love, but this is definitely one of my well kept secrets with not a huge line and serves my sweet tooth with great quality ice cream.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Great place with a wide selection of gelato, sorbet, and ice cream.

Of course the passionfruit sorbet is the most striking in appearance, but when sampling it I didn't find the taste that extraordinary. Eventually settled on hazelnut gelato (with real whole hazelnuts inside).

Appreciate the simple price structure too: $3 for a single, $4 for a double, and $5 for a triple. Family-run business with solid service.
author: Tim X.

description:
This ice cream shop is located in a great part of the Mission because there are no other ice cream shops nearby. 

But, here's the tea, my fine, feathered friends: The options are okay. I wish the gelato was milkier, but the flavors are pretty neat. I would suggest the lemon custard.
author: Edson M.

description:
This place was decent. They already had the crepes premade and warmed it up on the stove top. It was more food than I was expecting, but I'd recommend coming here for just a snack. 
The vanilla ice cream didn't taste like much. They do give the option of switching out the vanilla with a different flavor, which I'd recommend. Overall, it was more food than I was expecting and I left hungry for more. There's not that many seats inside the cafe, so no big groups might have a hard time finding seats.
author: Pryscilla T.

description: Ice cream is delicious friendly staff will definitely return. Mexican Vanilla was my favorite!
author: Miriam P.

description: The options in flavors are simply irresistible.  We have the exotics flavors like dragon fruit, black seasame, honey lavender, tamarind,  blood orange, tiramisu, dulce de leche, lucuma,  goat cheese, panna cotta, ...  there are options for vanilla and chocolate.  Must come in to experience the wonderful service and delicious flavors.
author: Anna C.

description:
Where have I've been all this time and not notice La Copa Loca delicious sorbet goodness? 

This place is quite amazing with their unique flavors of ice cream, gelato, and S-O-R-B-E-T!!!

It's less than $5, dirty cheap! 

I am in love with their dragon fruit and passion fruit flavor sorbet. Give it a whirl and you can thank me later. 

What are you waiting for? Go uh! 

I do hope you give this ice cream treat a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description:
Perfect gelato place in the heart of the Mission. Came here after a big meal and was not really craving anything heavy for dessert. What to eat? Gelato!

La Copa Loca means the "crazy cup" in Spanish, and serves up a pretty mean cup of gelato. There are many different flavors from the typical mango or pistachio to more exotic flavors like soursop and dragonfruit. As with any food joint, La Copa Loca caters to the local taste with all the wonderful assortment of fruit flavors that can be typically found in tropical Central and South America. ¡Qué rico!

I had two scoops of gelato- one kiwi and one blood orange, both of which were rich in flavor but not overly sweet. I also sampled a few other flavors such as the soursop and dragon fruit too, which weren't overly seer either.  I don't like my ice cream or gelato that is too sweet, so I was definitely pleased with the sweetness level of the gelato here. 

Overall I had a great first gelato experience here. I liked the variety of flavors (both usual and unusual) to both sample and eat. If you're feeling adventurous and want to try some exotic fruit flavor gelatos, come here!

Buen provecho!
author: Matthew L.

description: My favorite spot for crepes in SF!!! Tastes very close to French crepes and fruits are very fresh. Good quality ingredients.
author: J B.

description: Cute gelato shop in Mission. The interior is very modern. They offer coffee and milkshakes as well as gelato and crepes. If they had better signage, there would be crowds waiting outside. $4 for a single scoop is a tad pricey but it's nice they have an area to sit and lounge as well as a restroom for public use. Give this place a chance compared to more raved about spots in the area.
author: W A.

description:
I came here with a friend of mine.
We tried the crepes because we don't want to eat too much before dinner.
So, we had the crepes with strawberry jam, white mint gelato and marsmallow. Weird combo if I think about it.
But anyways, the taste is heavenly good!!!
They got a variety of gelato flavors. Totally come back for more!
author: Candice L.

description: I first have to really think this place for saving my ass and letting me go to the restroom being one of the only places on mission street with one available to customers! In terms of cleanliness and variety of the menu this place goes above and beyond. Now the only downside to this place is probably the portions, but I totally understand that gelato in general is not something that is really given in large amounts. In comparison to other local ice cream joints this place does not rank as my top three however that is the only thing stopping him from getting the fullfive stars. Check this place out if you're in the area!
author: Adrian G.

description:
La Copa Loca had a great variety of gelato flavors. I stopped by earlier today while my boyfriend was getting his haircut next door, and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the gelato I sampled. They have cool tropical flavors like soursop and dragon fruit as well as classic  flavors like chocolate and pecan. 

I ended up getting the panna cotta and passion fruit gelato -- it was creamy and sweet with a hint of tanginess. It wasn't super sour as most passion fruit flavored foods are which was fantastic. A definite must try if you're in the area.
author: Ivy L.

description: We tried the mango and dragonfruit sorbet. Both were very good! The dragonfruit tasted just like I froze a dragonfruit and are the meat of the fruit! I liked that they were not too sweet either.
author: Mary V.

description: Great little spot on a corner. I tested a few gelato flavors and they were all delicious---soft, creamy and fresh. I ended up going with a crepe with whip cream and a scoop of gelato. It reminded me of the ones i have tried in Italy. Definitely worth giving this place az try!!
author: Bethmarie R.

description: I work around the corner at the barber shop and I go into La Copa several times a week. When I am in a bad mood- a gelato sandwich always gets me in a good mood. When I am tired- nothing beats their black iced coffee. When I am hungry- a simple but filling breakfast sandwich with two eggs always hits the spot. The owners are a local family who are friendly, hard working, and always generous. Thank goodness for you La Copa Loca.
author: Jillian S.

description: First time here and it was sooooo good!! Had the Banana Noci Sundae, sooooo good! Definitely will be back to try other items on the menu!
author: Erika T.

description:
Finally, a place where dairy-free sorbet is offered not as an afterthought, but as a legitimate choice of frozen dessert. Prices are very reasonable compared with other such places in the area. Choice of flavors is fantastic, seasonal, and rotated regularly. Very good all in all. I come by here pretty regularly.
(edited) Sorry, having to take off a couple of stars for questionable hygiene. The person serving the ice cream handled a wad of cash money, then proceeded to take out cones without washing hands. Sure, there was that little napkin in his hand to try to prevent direct contact with the cone, but money is literally one of the dirtiest things possible, especially small denomination bills, so it seems like a good deal more care should be taken.
author: E. T. C.

description:
Ice cream was good. 

Price was very reasonable.

Service? I would say needs a lot of improvement. Came here with my kids. We tested different types of ice cream. I asked 3 times for the lady for extra spoon. Got frustrated that I reached over to get the spoons myself.
author: Leo M.

description:
Gelato!! So many flavors. I really could not decide!  Luckily, they encourage sampling!

I ended up with two scoops: passionfruit and dark chocolate. Both were delicious, but passionfruit was my favorite. Tart and sweet sorbet. Dark chocolate was rich and creamy.

He had 1 regular scoop of the coconut. Perfect coconut flavor and fluffy! We all loved it.  

Friend had toddler-sized dulce de leche. She loved it but I couldn't taste it due to the passionfruit. I did encourage her to help me with the dark chocolate though.  

Service = friendly.

Seating = bar seating. Enjoy.

Prices = moderate.  $26.00 for all three.
author: Fannie S.

description: very smooth, silky, with a perfect amount of softness and sweetness. There is many fruity, sorbet flavors along with some sweet flavors that fall under the umbrella of chocolate. Pretty decent pricing here as well, for example ifot a Double Scoop of Tiramisu Gelato in a Cup for $3.75. Would love to come back, especially on another rare hot sunny day in SF.
author: Stacey M.

description:
After having dinner nearby, my friends and I decided to grab dessert. I consulted my handy Yelp app and found La Copa Loca!

So how much did I love their ice cream?! So much that I didn't even take a pic of what I ordered! I did, however, manage to take pix of their display cases.

author: Elena N.

description: The sorbets are amazing. I've been coming here for a few years. My favorite sorbet of late is the dragon fruit. The flavors are strong. The staff is nice about allowing me samples till I find that special taste.
author: Eva UnTiger S.

description: La Copa Loca is phenomenal.  Really diverse range of flavors, accommodating to gluten free folk as well.  Pricing is incredible - 2 (generous) scoops for just $4?? Unheard of!  A lot of people rave about Garden Creamery, but I'd say this is arguably better.  Great spot to go to after dinner (esp if you're coming from mission st).
author: Curren I.

description: This neighborhood ice cream shop has quickly become a requisite stop for me whenever I am in the Mission.  The price for two scoops is a very reasonable $4 and I liked the tiramisu and hazelnut flavors.  No ridiculously long lines like at Bi-Rite and I hope it stays that way.  I plan to try more flavors here and I appreciate the friendly service and available inside seating.
author: Yoshi O.

description:
La Copa Loca's luscious nutella gelato and waffle cones get it done.  

Knowing that you didn't have to wait in a ridonkulous Bi-rite-esque line to get your fix?

EVEN SWEETER.
author: Amy C.

description: Tasty and decently priced-- I was hoping for salted caramel that they didn't have, so settled for the hazelnut which was still delicious and a generous one scoop portion.
author: Naomi S.

description:
La Copa Loca's got some real unique gelato flavors. Tiramasu? Rum raisin? I can dig it.

Their cash-only policy kind of stings, but getting a one-scoop cone clocks in at around $3 - not too bad overall when the gelato is this well made.
author: Casey S.

description:
The gelato and sorbet are both pretty good.
They also give you free tasting, so explore before you buy!
author: Rosemary V.

description: This weekend while wandering through the Mission District I found myself with a hankering for Gelato.  This eventually led me to La Copa Loca.  Being a Tiramisu lover I ordered a 20 Oz Tiramisu milkshake.  It didn't quite taste like Tiramisu to me but it was tasty nonetheless.  I think part of the reason is that the Tiramisu I usually have generally had an alcohol component such as Amaretto and this didn't.  I didn't really taste coffee in its place either.  However, I tasted the cream and lady fingers.  Regardless of the recipe being outside my tastebuds' usual range I still enjoyed it and would stop by again the next time I am in the area.
author: Joe I.

description:
After having dinner nearby, my friends and I wandered to La Copa Loca for some dessert. We came in about 15 minutes before closing and there was one person working behind the counter. She was really impatient with us because we weren't making our minds fast enough and I'm sure she wanted to close up shop. 

Anyways, La Copa Loca offers a lot of different gelatos and sorbets. I tried the white chocolate mint, dragon fruit, and pineapple. I really liked the dragon fruit sorbet, but the sample that I tried was really chunky. I ended up getting a single scoop of pineapple sorbet in a sugar cone because the sample I tried was smoother. The pineapple sorbet had a light pineapple flavor and not overly sweet. For the most part, my sorbet was smooth, but there were some big icy chunks. 

When I paid for the desserts my friends and I got, the receipt machine ran out of paper, which made the worker helping me out even more impatient. When she finally figured out how to reload the receipt paper correctly, there was no line for me to sign for my credit card and she just told me to sign somewhere on the receipt. I thought that was unprofessional in my opinion and her friends standing around, waiting for her to get off of work didn't help either.
author: Melanie H.

description:
I came here over an hour and a half before closing and they had already started to clean up and take out gelato for the night. 

I had 4-5 samples but nothing really was outstanding but I also didn't want to be that moocher so i got some chocolate kind and it was just okay. Maybe i came on a off day or maybe this place is overrated who knows.
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
Delicious gelato - dangerous that this place is so close to our place.  I've heard this place actually sources gelato to numerous nice restaurants in SF; we haven't had it out, but instead get it straight from the source.

All of the flavors we've tried have been delicious.  My favorites to date have been pistachio (always a favorite of mine) and the café/coffee flavors.  

My husband and I are huge gelato fans; we even took a gelato making class in NYC for fun.  We had learned that if you truly want to know whether a place makes good, authentic gelato, you should request to taste their pistachio flavor.  Because it's one of the more expensive flavors to make (due to the high price of the pistachios), many places don't use the actual nuts, but instead use artificial ingredients to "mock" the taste.  This place's gelato was creamy, delicious, had a great flavor, and yes - you called it - tasted just like you popped one of those delicious little green nuts in your mouth. 

Highly recommend.  Just a note - we've found the gelato doesn't do so great if you freeze it at home; we've gotten the larger "to-go" containers for nights we've had people over to serve alongside cake/desserts.  While still tasty, the texture isn't as good once it's been refrozen.  I'd recommend just getting a single serving and gobbling it up straight away :)
author: Rachael S.

description: Sadly this is the closest gelato to my house. Best part is the option of a toddler size for 2 bucks. I was just in Italy and this is what they would call "fake" or air pumped gelato. It had the wrong texture completely and the infamous mounds. Sorry!
author: Andrew K.

description: Really really really friendly staff here! Love the flavor choices and taste hits the spot! (I got yogurt milk & mixed Berries) Good price too. Try them out!!
author: Maki J.

description:
Is this heaven? 
Nop, it's just a Nutella&Banana crepe with ice cream.

I got here looking for dessert after a fairly poor dinner. I love that it's not only a plain ice cream shop!

I'm coming back to try one of their desserts.
author: Maggie J.

description:
sighs.. I was brought here by the scout mob 50% deal. Even for 50% off.. sadly I will not be returning here..

5 stars for the kind service.. but unfortunately that's all I can say that's positive about this place.

Tried most of the gelato in the back row, and the sorbet in the front. The sorbet was just overly sweet and icy with not much flavor. It tasted like syrup and ice.. The gelato was not milky or creamy or rich, just overly sugared with barely any milk taste. I had to actually debate whether or not to even order anything that is how unappealing everything was to me. I finally settled on the cookies and cream which was satisfactory and the hazelnut which I couldn't even force myself to finish.

The boy toy ordered a nutella banana crepe. I was appalled when a pre-made refrigerated stack of crepes were brought out and reheated.. EWWW.. It takes less than a minute to make fresh ones.. Needless to say, it was DRENCHED in chocolate sauce which was too sweet and barely edible. I had to take vanilla gelato as chaser to wash down and tone out the overbearing sweetness of this soggy reheated crepe. A few bites from both of us.. and into the trash it went..

Although this place is close-by, I would rather make the drive to Genki crepes or go without my gelato or crepe fix than stop by at this diabetes shop again.

What a shame..
author: Sharon N.

description:
Home-made gelato. 

Ordered it for the kids. They let me try a sample, but I am still trying not to eat desserts so much. 

Had some interesting flavors, but I wasn't super impressed with the selection. The ice cream/sorbet itself could have been more flavorful too. 

Wish we had braved Bi Rite. Next Mission visit!
author: Nora S.

description: After stuffing my face at Lolo, my friends and I wanted to grab some dessert.  Since our car was close by, we decided to stop by La Copa Loca for some gelato.  They had a variety of flavors to choose from.  What caught my eye in particular was the goat cheese and fig gelato.  It was good, but I wasn't sure if I'd be able to eat a whole thing of it.  My friend and I couldn't decide on a flavor so we decided to get a banana split.  We chose the mexican vanilla, coconut, and walnut.  Once it was in the banana split, all the flavors tasted... THE SAME! I couldn't tell what was what.  What a disappointment.  It wasn't horrible, but the fact that I couldn't distinct each flavor from which is.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
What's there to say? This place is straight dope. I get the 3/4 kilo every 1-2 weeks. Load up on their sorbet.

Coconut gelato and sour cherry are out of this world.
author: Ilya G.

description: i brought my family this weekend and we try the coconut flavor , it was really good i would bring my family again , it was a good experancice , to try a new , ice cream place ,,
author: Carlos H.

description:
My friends and I dropped by for some dessert (and some humorous stories from the owner about the neighborhood bums) after Lolo, with two of us getting gelato, and one of us getting a gelato shake. Having tried a handful of the different flavors, I'll say this: the flavors were both varied, and pretty tasty, but the texture was too soft/melty for what I'm used to gelato being.

But hey, if you're in the area, are in need of cheap, and fairly tasty dessert, why not? Oh, and they use Belly for their rewards system here!

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - My usual caveat about frozen dessert places stands here as well: the display cases are designed for "normal" height people, so it may be a little difficult to see all the labels. The inside may also make for a tight fit if the place is crowded (which was not the case at 9 or 10pm that Saturday).

Bathroom - Pretty sure there isn't a public one.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Bottom line at the top: gummy gelato, but they have unique flavors. 
--
They do a great job of clearly labeling gluten free, dairy free, sugar free, etc. Had the hazelnut and it was just okay.

They definitely have unique flavors but this city has better gelato and ice cream (Humphry, smitten)
author: Dahlia S.

description:
Saw all the positive reviews here on Yelp and was surprised to see there was absolutely no line here - compared to, say, Smitten on a nice day or Bi-Rite any time any day - but believe me, the buzz is worth it. Service is super friendly here, you can try as many as you want, and prices are very reasonable. 

There are a lot of unusual flavors to choose from, although I quickly settled on the cinnamon, which was refreshing and subtly sweet, and the Malaga, which was a heady, psychedelic combo of rum flavor and real raisins. Good gelato, good value. I'm pretty sure Ricky Martin wrote a song about this place once. ;)

I'll be back to try some of the more quirky flavors and offerings.
author: Vincent L.

description: Pitaya con coco at La Copa Loca! Another locally family owned gelato shop on the mission. Mauro and his family make their own gelato! Check them out on 22nd and Capp!
author: Marissa C.

description:
A nice bug selection of sorbets. The tamarind one was surprisingly good. 

The scoops were on the smaller side.
author: Wildeflower M.

description: Sooo many flavors to choose from! I always get the caffe espresso but have tried other flavors. The gelato has the right texture and taste. It totally hits the spot when we get the abnormal heat here or the overcast muggy/rainy weather. Space is a bit small but clean.
author: Marcela S.

description: Soooooo good & the staff is really knowledgable and able to help making your selections.
author: David F.

description: Rum and raisin! Ughh great flavor! Much better than bi-rite creamery!!!! And less crowded.
author: Itzia T.

description:
I was in the mood for ice cream so I looked for something local from my phone. I found this place.

It's a bit of a trip to go there, but I think it's worth it. It's not common to find a good gelato place in the Mission! Service isn't so bad either.

The place itself is really small and hardly noticeable, but the flavors they have are far from plain. They had some flavors I hadn't even heard of. I forgot the names already...you'll have to go there to see for yourself!

I ended up getting two scoops: goat cheese with fig and chocolate gelato. They had seating outside so I sat there enjoying the cone I had. The Mission is not exactly the most ideal place to sit outside in my opinion, but it was okay. 

I like this place. I wouldn't mind going back.
author: Sofia R.

description:
SWEET!
(4 stars)

Sweet find, sweet treat.

- Icecream, delicious
- prices, cheap/affordable
- service, fast
- ambiance, looks like a corner store with a few seats outside

Seems like this is where all the NATIVE mission district folks come for their icecream fixes while the "hipsters" are the down the street at Humphrey Slocombe's. I admit, I am one of those people who are 'down the street' but after being exposed to this place I wouldn't mind coming here for some good ice cream, it's alot better on the wallet too. 
Had the HAZELNUT icecream, more like a light chocolate with hazelnut flavor icecream. SO GOOD. If your in the area, i recommend coming here and checking it out. I love coming to the mission and seeing NATIVE mission still be in their neighborhood going to their local sweet shops.

Will I be back? YUP.

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
I love this place! It's way better than the bougie ice cream at bi-rite that you have to wait forever for. They have more flavors and other things on their menu. 

The guy was super helpful and didn't mind that I wanted to try them all.
author: Mariana L.

description: This is my regular ice cream spot. Lots of flavors and open late! Their waffle cone is the best. They have a nice selection gluten free and dairy free options too!
author: Janice T.

description: After my trip to Italy last year, I've been dying to find a spot that serves gelato as smooth and creamy like they did. La Copa Loca comes SO close! They have a bunch of flavors and are open late-ish. I really enjoyed the sesame gelato and would totally be back to try the rest of the flavors.
author: Kim N.

description: I used La Copa Loca's Gelato Catering for my office's big 50th anniversary party and it was perfect! Working with Mauro was great and he was able to help us figure out exactly what we needed for our group of 300 people. We were excited to go to La Copa Loca to sample the flavors before choosing our top six for the event and I can tell you that this was so hard to do because they were all SO good. We ended up selecting Dulce de Leche, Chocolate Hazelnut, White Mint Chocolate Chip, Pumpkin Cheesecake, Pineapple Lavender, Green Tea ...a good variety of options for everyone. I'd say the top two favorites were White Mint Choc. Chip and Dulce de Leche. Mauro and his assistant arrived just on time and set up while our event was going on-- people couldn't wait to get in line to get a scoop. I'm so happy we were able to work with La Copa Loca and are looking forward to having them at our next work event!
author: Kelly D.

description: Great service, great ice cream, overall very, very great! They have the most exotic ice cream flavors and they are all really good! Also the staff is very kind and friendly!
author: Elena P.

description: I ordered a hazelnut gelato. It was good and melted very quickly. I don't think it was anything out of the ordinary, though.
author: Sharon L.

description:
THE ABSOLUTE WORST "ARTISAN" GELATO WE HAVE EVER HAD! 
I cannot believe anyone who calls themselves an "artisan" chef would not TASTE their product before allowing it to be served!!  Gelato has a very beautiful and specific taste and texture - SWEET & SMOOTH!  In La Copa Loca's "gelato"  there was NONE of this!  
1. Absolutely NO dimension to the flavors whatsoever! We ordered a Coconut, Vanilla, and Panna Cotta w/ whisky sauce sundae. Everything except the Panna Cotta  tasted exactly the same.  The only reason you could tell the difference in the Panna Cotta is because of the whiskey stripe and little bit more sugar!

2. Crunchy, not as in toasted coconut crunchy. Crunchy as in icie no flavor crunchy. What's up with that?

3. EVEN the CARAMEL SAUCE had no flavor! REALLY?

4. The severely underwhelming whipped creme made it ALL worse- NO FLAVOR at all! Do you know how horrible unflavored crunchy gelato is? 

Why did we not go back and return the bland white concoction? Because it was late, it was closing and I was ANGRY! Foodie Friends, you know how horrible it feels to be so excited about something you LOVE, that you know it is nearly impossible to mess up (all gelato needs is SUGAR and a creamy beautiful flavor!), and when you get it is disappoints you to tears.....?  

Yeah, that happened.  

I normally would give a place a second shot, but I'm too scared. They killed one of my very favorite things for me... How? Why?
author: Milan F.

description:
Strawberry Aloe - enough said.  This little ice cream shop serves up a "Crazy Cup" of gelato.  The cool and refreshing flavors soothe any ailment and the flavors really do pack a punch.  If only the neighborhood was a little better to warrant more trips to this location... I can see that being a big deterrent to most of the people walking by.

Make sure to stop in and try out a sample.  You wont be leaving empty handed.
author: Kevin J.

description:
The woman/owner? behind the counter has a sour face that makes "don't fuc* with the Chuck" Chucky look friendly and she really lets you know with her motions she's doing you a favor as she scoops your "treat". I don't mind negative attitude if product is good and service is efficient, but get any scoop of their iced stuff and flavors get lost. NOTHING distinctive stands out. 

With this economy you're better off doing yourself a favor whipping out your ice cream machine and making something FLAVORFUL. Some local shops might not appreciate your business. 

* It doesn't matter if you've made a purchase, she charges to sit on the benches.
author: Darth M.

description:
We got excited, Bi-Rite Creamery was closed but this place sounded cool!

The flavors were hard to read because everything said "GLUTEN FREE" underneath. I think 2 flavors had gluten...we aren't surprised that the lemon sorbet is gluten free....

I got a small coffee and chocolate. The prices were great, but the gelato was not. It took a while to realize, but it just wasn't very flavorful and there were ice crystals-as if they had watered it down somehow.
author: Amanda H.

description: Awesome smoothies and chai in a local Mission shop. Everything was made to order so it was a bit slow. Also, we ordered a lemonade which was so strong it was basically undrinkable. Even after graciously taking it back and adding more sugar -- only barely drinkable. This drink needs some "fine tuning".
author: Andrew S.

description: This place is awesome! On hot days it could get quite busy, but the staff is super nice and patient. The gelato flavor offerings are great (tiramisu! hazelnut! coconut! pistachio!), and I also highly recommend the smoothies -- made with fruit chunks, milk, and their very own gelato!
author: Sara H.

description: Lemon meringue cookies and mascarpone mixed together is so good! Great prices and the sampling experience was delightful.
author: Kenzie J.

description:
Upside, inside out I'm lickin' la copa loca!
It'll push your belly out, lickin' la copa loca!

Whatever happened to Ricky Martin anyway? Oh well, with Humphry Slocombe just down the block now and Bi-Rite, Bombay and Mitchell's not that much further away, I'm afraid La Copa Loca may just get lost in the lactose-intolerant shadows of the Mission. That would be a shame because there are pleasures here that involve the tongue and the palate and don't involve me taking off my clothes. See, I just gave you another reason to come here.

It's a compact place that you would pass by were it not for the glow-in-the-dark, giant ice cream cone (see photo). Enter and you're immediately struck by all the color in the glass case - a blinding combination of gelato, sorbets and sherbets, about thirty in all (see photos). I have to admit I was immediately drawn to the pumpkin sherbet and the pineapple sorbet since it felt like the appropriately lighter treat to have after a pan full of lobster paella at Esperpento.

Then I went truly decadent by asking for a peanut-encrusted, chocolate-dipped cone to house those tantalizing flavors. Somehow it all worked. It was refreshing, and I honestly didn't miss the creaminess of the gelato. I just may have to skip the Blue Bottle Vietnamese at Humphry Slocombe and go for something tropical at La Copa Loca on a hot summer night. Hey, it could happen.

SORBET/SHERBET - 4 stars...refreshing and then some
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...it's a small, comforting place...be prepared to take it outside
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...scoops with the best of them
TOTAL - 4 stars...if you get tired of Humphry, Mitchell's, Bi-Rite or Bombay, you probably need a tummy tuck...but do come to La Copa Loca for the sorbets and sherbets
author: Ed U.

description:
Revisted today, even though I said I wouldn't. I moved into the neighborhood and it is the closest ice cream place to my house.

I tried the vanilla and cinnamon flavors today. Stuck with Cinnamon and similarly like last time, my complaint is still that the ice cream is not well blended. There still little bits and chunks of weird stuff and ice in it. But the flavor was decent.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I've been coming here since they'e opened back in 05. 

It's the same shit, different day...

But lemme tell you this, IT'S SOME BOMB ASS SHIT.

Yeah, yeah, it's not ice cream, but at least this doesn't give me the hershey squirts like Mitchell's does. Plus I don't get down with Mitchell's. Shit tastes like freezer flakes.
author: Jose J.

description: We found this place by luck! (Was parked across the street) What a find! My boys and I all had the crepes. They were so good!!! A big plus...friendly customer service! My kids and I can't wait to come back!
author: Lee E.

description:
My little stroll around the Mission took me to La Copa Loca. As I walked by the store I was surprised at my own quick reflex of glancing back at a very attractive woman walking out. Well, it wasn't about her and her yoga pants because I just lost the opportunity to treat, but it was more about the colorful accessory she was carrying; a tall pink double scoops on an attractive waffle cone. All of the sudden, I found her equally quick reflex towards the waffle cone as she took the biggest bite I have ever seen of anyone. Wow, it was love at first bite--the waffle cone I mean. 

So I had to walk in opposite of the woman into the store to check out these gelati. The store was tiny with an overhead sign to encompass a menu of gelati, crepes, among other sweets and treats. There were a few chairs and tables available outside with a big sign that features their corn flavored gelato among other flavors. After some unenthused sample of their mango and mint chocolate gelati, I decided to go with a scoop coffee and pistachio on a waffle cone ($3.50). My first bite into the pistachio had a licorice sensation so it took me a few more bite in order to get adjusted. The coffee flavor was pretty good and the server did a nice job at packing the cone all the way to the bottom. Texture-wise, it was not as thick and air tight as some other gelato places, so it's difficult to consider this a traditional gelato experience as it tasted closer to a thick and creamy ice cream. 

Initially I had some thoughts about getting their crepes but a few of their crepe skins that were left on the counter looked sloppy and unappetizing. In addition, service was distanced with the server looking annoyed when I asked for the receipt. Otherwise, I did enjoy my generous sized waffle cone that came at a good price. 3.5 stars for the overall experience. I hope to come back to try their other seasonal flavors such as persimmon sorbet and other "streaked" gelato flavors.
author: Daniel L.

description: GOOD gelato, great selection, and nice bathrooms! Seating is limited to a counter, but there are a few tables outside. Make your gelato an "Italian" (whip cream, chocolate sauce, caramel crunch) for $1!
author: Alison Z.

description: My favorite for sorbets without a crazy line.  (Is bi-rite better? Someone with more tolerance for lines can weigh in). On the ice cream side, goat cheese and fig was fantastic.  Walnut was super nutty, as was pistachio.
author: cranky p.

description:
this place is the bomb

I know Bi-Rite is amazing, and I love it too - but you can get quality here for much less without waiting in line for 30 minutes

this is my go-to place for frozen treats in the Mission, for sure
author: Mark B.

description: CHEAP, Excellent service and really yummy various flavors! i always pick chocolate but some flavors had me question chocolate of all things! AND even the sugar cone tasted crisp and fresh(: defiantly coming here again!
author: Lara H.

description:
This place is by far the best ice cream store in town! I come here regularly but this is actually the first review I give, after like 10 visits! 
They have all kind of favor, especially the tart kind!! So hard to find ice cream that isnt too sweet that will rot your teeth, so this is definitely my to go place. Plus all the fruit favor are amazing!! 
Recommend the dragonfruit, lemon, and tart, if you are more into sour taste.
author: Janice S.

description:
Soooo much better than Bi-Rite. 

I'm not a big Yelper (yet), but as soon as I went here, I got online to review it.

I've lived in SF for 14 years, years, and La Copa Loca is hands-down the best gelato or ice cream place I've been to. In fact, it's the best one I've been to outside Italy. 

Amazing flavors--a selection of 24 or more by my count, including tamarind, passion fruit, Mexican vanilla, dragon fruit, and soo many more. Flavors and textures from refreshing sorbets to ice-creamy gelatos--and beautiful to look at!

They even make custom frozen cakes and tons of other stuff, all to your specifications. 

Super friendly, refreshingly diverse staff and customers--unlike the offensively long lines and over-fabulous, less diverse Bi-Rite staff. The woman who helped me took her time and even suggested flavors to me--I tried 6 sample spoons without being rushed. 

I could say so much more, but you get the picture.
author: Brent C.

description: First time here with the family and it's awesome. Definitely will come back here. I don't like gelatos but this one made it a good experience.
author: Uatisone M.

description:
Our boy Jose hooked it up. We stumbled in at like 10pm and were craving sweets after Panchita's #3 and Copa Loca (aka crazy cup) was open. 

I tried the caramello gelato and it was damn tasty. I had a small $2 cup and it was awesome. It wasn't rich and milky like other gelatos, but rather light and tasty. 

Jose was very friendly and gladly talked with our large group. 

I'm going to stop by and say hi and buy some ice cream. I'm all about nice people with a quality product.
author: Carlos A.

description: I Am Not much of an ice cream person, mostly because it tends to be too sweet for me.  NOT this ice cream, their ice cream is not only refreshing, but just the right amount of sweetness.  I really like that they have unique flavors ... tamarindo?! Guanavana?! delicious!! Try his place out!
author: Rosa G.

description:
Even though it was freaking freezing outside, five of us came here in the late evening to satisfy our ice cream cravings.  

We sampled more than a few flavors ...to the point where I swear I saw the guy behind the counter rolled his eyes at us.  LOL....

Some of the flavors were pretty good like pistachio, cookies and cream, and raspberry gelato.  And then there was the really disappointing flavor like the mint chocolate chip.  I grew up loving and having mint chocolate chip ice cream.  I was really hoping La Copa Loca would wow me with its mint flavor but instead it tasted more like toothpaste than mint chip.  Yeah I didn't want pay for a scoop of toothpaste.  So I settled with the raspberry gelato even though I wasn't too crazy about it. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Ew12TaYkYC3bkUiJ36gdLg?select=LjOBD3T-1Jg-b2DMPG7IDQ 

I have a feeling that if I tasted any more flavors, I would not have liked their gelato as much as a 3 star.
author: Hannah C.

description:
I like La Copa Loca; it's one of my preferred places for ice cream / gelato in the area.  Their sorbet and gelati flavors are consistently good; in my opinion, some of the other ice cream shops have great flavors and misses.

Some of the sorbets are real winners here; they are great on a warm day in the Mission.  I especially like the lemon rosemary (when they have it).  The gelati is not too creamy; I'm not a fan of the high fat ice cream produced by some of the trendier places in town.  La Copa Loca is closer in style to Italian.

Yeah, Copa Loca never captured the attention of the 20-something cool crowd.  That's fine with me.  Prices are more reasonable and they attract a diverse neighborhood following.  They also produce dessert items for some of the better local restaurants (La Ciccia is one example).  I believe that there is an ownership/investor connection to Pasta Pomodoro as well.  Service is friendly.  Not much ambiance in the shop, but I like the lighted ice cream cone displayed outside.
author: Jice E.

description: This place was so cute, but alas it wasn't that good. Good bang for your buck though.
author: Heather R.

description:
I came across their goat-cheese-and-fig, and their marsala wine gelati at La Ciccia, and have made this a regular Mission destination.  Copa Loca's flavors and combinations intoxicate. 
They vary their offerings because the list of choices is so long.  If you don't see your favorite, ask -- it might just not be out front at the moment.  Any way you go, you won't be disappointed.
author: Theresa B.

description: I'm from Rome. If you never been to Italy, here is your chance to, at least, get an idea of our lifestyle and dolce vita :) Gelato test like whatever the name you read, not too sweet or fat like your usual ice cream. Simply the best...
author: Anton R.

description:
I *really* wanted to love La Copa Loca for several reasons:
- I can't get enough of ice cream and all of its many delicious variants, including gelato.
- I live right next door to this place (Uh, did I just give away my location on the Internet?  Don't stalk me, please).
- It's pretty cheap for SF.  $3.75 gets you two large scoops and a waffle cone.  Not bad.
- Despite its location in the Mission, it's still under the hipster radar so there's never a line. (!!!)
- It's a local business with a heart-warming ambition.  Straight from their website: "Our goal is simple: Provide the best gelato in San Francisco to our faithful patrons for reasonable prices in a friendly, warm environment."  How great is that?

But try as I might (and I did try quite a few times), I just can't fall in love with a gelato place if the gelato itself is pretty forgettable.  On one occasion I've even found chunks of ice in my gelato, which was memorable in a bad way.  I'm not even sure that what they serve here is truly considered gelato.. It leans more on the icy, sherbet-y side than the creamy and rich side, which isn't necessarily a bad thing and actually makes for a refreshing treat on a warm day in the Mission, but I just wanted to point that out in case you were expecting gelato of the denser, creamier variety.

So overall, this place is just alright.  If it weren't for all the other factors that I've listed then I would for sure spend my ice cream money elsewhere.  I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

For those reviewers who commented on the "sketchy location" here: shaddup!  That's where I live, too, hmph!  *insert angry face emoticon here because Yelp doesn't allow for greater-than symbol to connote angry emoticon eyebrows in reviews for some dumb reason*
author: Alice C.

description:
Not a bad deal, and an even better deal since they seem to participate in various offers and mobile payment options.

The shop is small, there's a little bench out front, but no real place to eat otherwise.

They were very friendly, letting us sample their selection of many flavors.  The flavors are often quite strong, but also seemed a little artificial.  We eventually settled on a cup with two scoops, and one of their more elaborate creations - I think it was the Tropicale, with some melon and pineapple slices and a generous dose of whipped cream.

There's a lot to choose from in this welcoming little shop, and the quality is ... as the rating says ... A-ok.
author: Albert H.

description: So yummy! I can't eat gelato and the worker, francisco I think, was so nice and was totally patient with me. Thanks for a great experience!
author: isaac t.

description: Far and away the best gelato I've had in SF. I couldn't stop saying how delicious it was the whole time I ate it as I walked home. It was F*ing amazing!! I had the guanabana and tiramisu and they were both soo good. My boyfriend got the strawberry cheesecake in a cone and loved it. Def my new local SF gelateria. This place is way better than birite or lush.
author: Sydney G.

description: Nice little sorbet spot. They have a lot of interesting flavors and variety. It is a bit small but it's definitely a good place to stop by and grab something to cool you off during the summer time. I had the caramel and pistachio mix and really enjoyed it.
author: Maria C.

description:
I will admit, I am an ice cream and gelato fan, I LOVE desserts, dairy treats, sweets but most of all, I try food for the experience.    I tried many exotic flavors which really appealed to the explorer in me.  I end up getting a $6.50 half kilo container of ice cream that has six scoops -one of each flavor!  Very nice if you can't make up your mind with just one like me!

I asked the person behind the counter if she owns the place and she said yes =) 

generous samples and friendly service makes this place a winner in my book.   Will be back with a few friends, yum!
author: Jamie L.

description: A great variety of flavors both fruity and chocolatey!! The menu is pretty big so you might want to take a step back and take your time looking through the whole menu. My favorites are on the window of the ice cream case not on the menu so make sure you check that out. Only place I've been to with dragon fruit sorbet fantastic!!!
author: Jean-Luc D.

description:
Lucuma gelato? How is that possible? Nevermind, just hand it over. 

And all the rest of your gelato. NOM. 

Also: while we were there, the person managing the store had an extended, respectful conversation with a homeless person. That was pretty classy.
author: Rob R.

description: Awesome staff at Copa Loca , I took my girlfriend here on her birthday and Francisco made it an awesome experience !! Delicious ice cream and gelato !
author: Equis U.

description: Came here with an old friend, wandering SoMa during my first trip to the West Coast. The girls were young and Latin, and let us try a bunch of delicious things. The vanilla soy ice cream tastes like vanilla pudding! I got it with some berries in a shake. To-die for!
author: Jan Marie D.

description: great selection of gelato and fair prices, yuma
author: Long C.

description: You can see the website.. the chef used to make gelato for the queen if England and other celebrities.  The large is a bit cheaper, at $5/cup, instead of the usual $8/cup.  The pineapple is really awesome.. even my bf ate 3 cups in a row n he's Italian.. it must be good.. :-D
author: Cristina R.

description:
La Copa Loca offers a welcome gelato option in San Francisco apart from the overpriced mainstays in North Beach.

The gelato flavors are newly made everyday (so samples are generously provided at the end of the night), and this freshness is evident in the impossibly perfect blend of iciness, creaminess, and airiness of each bite.  The waffle cone exudes a similar comfort of freshness in its delightful crispiness and sticky sweet scent.

The Lucuma and Yogurt tandem piled into a waffle cone aptly captures the essence of a warm summer night.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Oh my goodness oh my goodness.  Gelato in the Mish.  

Just an FYI for y'all, the gelato here really isn't "true" gelato.  For me, the word gelato invokes feelings of creamy, decadent, fattening, luxurious, melt-in-my-mouth deliciousness.  If anyone has the scoop--no pun intended--on the real gelato here in San Francisco, by all means, HOLLA!  Maybe I have to go back to Italy for that.  

Instead, La Copa Loca offers some really yummy, uniquely flavored ice cream and sorbets.  They make their own.  It's a tiny little joint.  Coconut "gelato" is a winner.  Melon sorbet was oddly, um, like eating a melon.  How'd they do that?  Even soy based flavors for all the vegans!

So many more flavors to try.  Yogurt (yep, it's a flavor), pistachio, hazelnut, here I come!
author: Angella S.

description:
What a charming little creamery / gelato spot.

Friendly, passionate workers is something I love to see and the young lady and chef were both loco about their spot.

A sense of ownership goes a long way.

All the gelato and what not is made in-house by el chef, another plus.

Mint chocolate chip on a sunny mission afternoon was delectable. Was scraping the bottom of the cup for more. 

Keeping this post simple, because La Copa Loca is just that - simple goodness.
author: Phil H.

description: This place went under major renovations, and everything they did was a major improvement. I would definitely recommend you stop in and check it out! The gelato is tasty, the service is fast and friendly. Stop in soon!
author: Chase L.

description: Great flavors and cheap! A great little dessert spot that's not too crowded, just watch the neighborhood it's a little dodgy.
author: Maeling D.

description:
Yummy!!! Went here on a warm afternoon while on a date with my hubs. Note, my he does not like sweets but will indulge in sorbets. He absolutely loved the flavors and quality of this "off the beaten path" shop of gelato! I considered it yummy myself! We loved the flavors we chose (mango & pineapple and the Mr. picked lemon & summer berries). We sat out on the quaint bench and enjoyed our refreshment!

Then my sister in law was in the neighborhood and decided to join us (she lives across the bay so we welcome each others company when opportunity presents itself)! She ordered the Spaghetti Cabonara sundae. They pressed the gelato through a noodle making sort of contraption. The ice cream looked like spaghetti!!! How fun is that? Chocolate sauce and hazelnuts with whipped cream topped off this dessert for her and she too was awed by the presentation! It was pretty unique! They have quite a selection of sundaes that all have their own quirky presentation using flavors infamous to different parts of the world!!! 

Looking to go back and try the different flavors they make, in house might I add! Funnnnn!

They make coffee and espresso drinks as well should u need an additional boost from the sugar high!
author: Candy R.

description: Rude customer service. Only okay gelato. There are so many options for frozen treats nearby. Don't waste your time here.
author: Sara L.

description:
I really wanted to like this place ~ good friends recommended it, lots of glowing reviews, mom and pop shops warm my heart, etc. Perhaps I came at an off moment? Here are the reasons for giving my experience a two.

Reason 1: I patiently waited a while, while a family of 3 were being served. When my order was ready to be taken, the reception was tepid. 

Reason 2: My little cup of frozen berry gelato wobbled as he put it on the counter. I was preoccupied by the large bags I had on me as I was digging my money out and didn't think to push the cup back to a more stable place. As I handed him my money, the cup splat on the ground. He asked if I wanted another (of course I did ~ I hadn't even had a bite). That kind of question makes me feel that he wants to charge me. I explained what had happened and he reluctantly scooped me another.

Reason 3: The frozen berry treat wasn't all that flavorful. 

A disappointment all around.
author: Cathy K.

description: OK icecream, disappointing service. Won't be back for $2.50 a tiny scoop
author: E T.

description:
Let me just say, if you love Guava, then the Guava gelato here at La Copa Loca is the way to go! You would seriously feel like you're eating the fruit, including the skin! 
 
The flavors of the gelato stayed true to its name, service was great, parking can be a hassle, and it's SUPER TINY! There is one bench outside and it's not ideal to hang out at the corner with your group of friends. Other than that, just get your gelato and you'll definitely be pleased!
author: Cindy C.

description:
I finally got to try La Copa Loca - gelato in the Mission.  I saw the sign and had to try it.  It's on 22nd @ Capp.

I tried a few flavors: vanilla, mango, black cherry, & something else.  All tasted fine.

B. got vanilla on a regular cone $2.25 and I got hazelnut on plain cone $2.25.  I think the vanilla is pretty tasty.  Hazelnut had lots of tiny hazelnut so it was a bit too crunchy & not smooth enough for me.

I should have gotten the special flavor: Guanabana.  Oh well, next time.  Girl said mango & coconut are popular.  Stick w/ the fruit flavors others have said.

1 scoop $2.25
2 - $3.25
3 - $4
toddler scoop $1.75

Lg waffle .50c
MD waffle 25c
peanut waffle $1
sprinkles waffle 75c

plain cone -free I think
sugar cone 10c

Hrs:
M 1-9
T-Th 9-10
F-Sa 9-11
Sun 10-10

They take Credit Cards.  No sitting inside, but there's some sitting outside.
author: Ann L.

description: Love the wild flavors available - sapotey, red bean, tamarind
author: Philip T.

description: Love this place it's right next to my job, they're ham and egg croissants are soo yummy in the mornings and on hot days I suggest their dark chocolate gelato.
author: Isabel L.

description: The gelato at my office is better.
author: Jess C.

description: I was excited to read all these wonderful reviews on yelp and decided to score some brownie points with my man that is a ice cream snob and took him there but the experience back fired. On the website there are like over 50 flavors listed and when you walk into the tiny store maybe 18 are being served. I tried walnut that tasted weak, green apple tasted like 1960's dinner if that makes any sense and coffee tasted was just really weird and not like coffee. I ended up having toddler scoop for $1.75 of hazelnut that was just fine. I will keep searching.
author: Magda G.

description: This place is awesome. They have great hours and are open everyday of the week and open until 10 pm about everyday. They have a huge variety of both gelato AND sorbet. Personally I love the waffle cone with 1 scoop of caramel gelato and 1 scoop of coconut  which comes out to $3.75 for 2 scoops in a waffle cone. The staff are mostly nice and friendly except for one older lady who acted so stingy when my boyfriend and I wanted to sample a few flavors,  she had attitude and acted like it was taking money from her wallet. If I had never been helped by this woman I'd give the place five shiny stars.
author: lindsay b.

description:
Strawberry, mint chip and coconut - yum!  

On the way out my son says to the lady at the counter, "You have really good ice cream!"
author: Pam S.

description: I Stopped by to try this place , and so far the best gelato in town and I saw the owner of the place and he or was acting like a Good owner that takes good  care of things and make sure things were good.
author: Phill B.

description: This is a cute corner corner gelateria with great prices for gelato and sorbet with a variety of flavors. Today, for example, they had honey thyme, nougat, passion fruit, and zabaione, among others. The honey thyme was very herb-y and refreshing. Unlike some other yelpers, we had no trouble with service; the people were very nice as we indecisively sampled flavors. I would totally come back!
author: Clarice W.

description:
Smallish but legit gelato shop.

Affordable prices.

Lots of selections and containers to eat it in.

Tried the mango. It was legit.
author: Andrew M.

description: Very good selection of sorbet, very yummy. The cashier was ever so friendly and helped us make some good selections. Ordered some for a dinner we recently held. It was definitely a hit amongst everyone. I would definitely recommend this place, you may get hooked like we are :)
author: Ronette B.

description: Pretty authentic little gelato spot. Would have never known it was there and stumbled across it.  Hazelnut was super good! Wish they had a few more flavors but the quality was pretty good. I would stop by again if I was in the neighborhood and needed a sweet fix, but am still looking for the best gelato in the City.  PM me if you have a recontamination!
author: Chelsey G.

description: La Copa Loca! Has a good selection of gelato which always taste fresh and delicious! They even have some sugar free flavors which are great with people with diabetes. I will surely come back, but please walk or bike here the parking sucks!
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description: Being a gelato connoisseur, I am greatly impressed by the product offered in this establishment as well as the handsome price that goes with it. The flavors were rich and strong and pungent... I had a three scoops build your own sundae and it was absolutely amazing... The whip cream was freshly made and it topped off with chopped hazelnuts. I'm so excited that they are open late till 10 p.m. So I can come by for a late night. I highly recommend enjoy!
author: Yolanda S.

description:
mostly they have no egg mixture but mostly contain milk, but you can ask the salessenorita which one is which/not.
i usually lick + slurp: madagascar vanilla & panna gelato. that's all they're delicious!!
definitely luv is all i can say!
author: Ms C.

description: Omg!! Panna Cotta Gelato! Alot of interesting flavors here and the best of it all - Panna Cotta - they only sell as pints and larger.
author: Nicole M.

description: Great gelato! Tried the vanilla cinnamon and it was delicious. There was no wait and the server was very helpful
author: Jamie Z.

description: This stuff is hella bomb. Last time I went I got vanilla gelato between two yummy ginger bread tasting cookies!! It was nirvana in my mouth. I love this place.
author: Katlyn B.

description:
I don't know if it's authentic gelato, I just know it's fabulous. The hazelnut & dark chocolate are the bomb. So is the blood orange sorbet. 

And if you're thirsty, try the fresh lemonade made-to-order. Awesome.
author: Lisa M.

description: Very tasty, great variety of interesting flavors, and reasonably priced. The woman working there gave me tons of tasty samples and I will definitely go back for more!
author: Zachary B.

description: La Copa Loca had delicious gelato - I highly recommend their coconut and hazelnut!
author: Tasha A.

description:
This unassuming shop looks closed when you drive by but don't be misled. The selection is straight forward and there isn't a line here (!!!) I think it has the potential to be a 4 but I just picked the wrong icecream to buy (even though I tried them all. Fail on my part)

The root beer really tastes like root beer. The pineapple rosemary is delicious, has a nice sorbet taste to it. The hazelnut is a classic that is always dependable. The chocolate is straight forward standard too.

All in all, a good choice if you happen to be in the area but I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here. But if you're in the area, might as well drop by.
author: Diana Y.

description:
You know how gourmet ice cream is the new black?  There's the Bi Rite Creamery near Dolores, Ici in Berkeley, and countless other places that mix honey with lavender and salt with caramel.  It's all quite delicious.

Well here's a little secret: it's hard *not* to enjoy ice cream or any of its other incarnations (gelato, milkshakes, Its-Its, etc), and you often don't have to go to the latest trendy spot to find it.  Take "La Copa Loca" as an example: it's a standard corner shop featuring the usual array of gelatos.  I tried the coconut for $2.  Not only was it top notch -- I mean really top notch -- but did I mention it was $2?  

Point being: you don't have to follow the crowds to Bi Rite (as delicious as their product is too).  La Copa Loca will likely serve you up just fine and put a smile on your face.
author: Laurence W.

description:
YOU MUST GO!!!!! how easy is that. I should just stop it that, but I won't.  
OHHHHH I have tasted Gelato for years and so far this is the best. It's light, creamy, tastie and at the end of the night, in your bed watching your favorite movie or show you let it sit and melt just right.........omgosh, it;s heaven in a bowel.........

you have to go and then you'll know how gelato should taste and what's really great, they are moderately priced and you get a good amount. 

Don't do like me though, they know me and I am a regular and my pants have passed regular now too. Got to go to the gym and start walking, I can't stop my pleasure....
Best ever!
author: cat u.

description: There are a number of flavors of gelato including tamarind. Some flavors are vegan and some noted as gluten free (?) The very bright colors and the piled high containers clued me in that there were some artificial colors and flavors as well as something unnatural stabilizing this stuff. I got a nougat and a pistachio scoop. Not too sweet. But the flavors were not intense or fresh. The texture was sandy. I would not go back.
author: Lucy L.

description: This was our next stop after the YEE at Nombe . A small posse of Yelpers -Ed Lover , Bobby , Peter, Darryl and I went for some Gelato. La Copa Loca is a nice neighborhood shop . Its a hole in the wall . Did a little sampling of the Gelato and ended up getting the Rasberry and Cookies and Cream Gelato  Mmm Yummy .
author: Eugene L.

description:
Got the low cal chocolate and it wasn't any good.  

Perhaps I share part if the blame for getting the low cal variety, but what a disappointment .  

I'll never go back.
author: Kitty M.

description: I'm liking this wacky gelato shop. It's not fancy pants, but you get straight up good tasting gelato for a good price. Those weird snowmen creations? They're real! But they reside in the little freezer display, which is far less appetizing. They've got a pretty big selection, mostly fruity flavors and a few herby flavors at once at most. You can tell which flavors are made fresh and I love that they have fresh batches even way late in the night. I had the coconut and mango the other night to follow up on my Thai food dinner. It was just the thing. The mango wasn't too mangoy, but it had fresh pieces of real mango in it. The coconut was really good though. The service isn't much, but at prices like these, who needs it? A double scoop is $3.25, no tax.
author: Jennifer W.

description: good gelato & sorbet, very clean, lots of flavors, papaya, dragon fruit, mango, walnut, cream, toffee, sooooo good! nice staff offers tastes, and clean bathroom.
author: Gabi M.

description: My favorite gelato/sorbet joint in SF remains flawless. I popped in yesterday and settled on the Tiramisu gelato after trying some of their newer flavors like Strawberry Basil and Vanilla Ginger. Oh man, they got it right again. Tiramisu is my favorite dessert, and they reconstructed it into a flavor-packed, portable creamy treat perfect to enjoy while walking through the Mission on a beautiful Indian Summer day. Bypass the lines at Bi-Rite and get down there, because The Crazy Cup is crazy good!
author: Josh J.

description:
I've said that fried chicken is the way into my heart.

I lied. 

Chocolate gelato is WAY more effective!

La Copa Loca turned my frown upside down with just one taste of the delicious chocolate gelato.  

Drool.....
author: Jay H.

description:
Great stuff.
And, they make an excellent non-fat latte.
author: Carl C.

description:
I had the Cassata Italiana and it was awesome.  Basically, it's got vanilla and pistachio gelato in the center with candied fruit speckled inside (a la spumoni) and a dome-shaped chocolate gelato covering on the outside.  Real whipped cream and cherry on top.  Very tasty.  I'm impressed with the flavors and the creative concoctions.  The gelato (although on the icier side of gelatos) is also not too sweet, which I really appreciate.  

A totally solid gelato shop.  I'm going to go back and try more of the elaborate gelato desserts they have spinning in the glass case.
author: Diana Y.

description: The service here was very nice & helpful. The guy asked me if I wanted to sample anything. I said no, but he gave me samples of popular ice creams anyways. That's good Customer service & sales. I asked him which was a good fruity milky drink & he explained why each of them were good. He said he could add extra stuff to my drink too. Also, when I was gonna get a straw, the lady opened one up, turned around & put it in my drink. Usually, you would get your own, but this was unexpected! Good experience. =D
author: Jocelyn C.

description: Flavorful gelato (and sorbet, for those poor lactose intolerant souls) for cheap.  Nuf said.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
The pumpkin gelato was good but the fruits of the forest was a bit too fruity and sweet for me.

Once again proved my point that the further to the MotherLand, the lesser the quality. 

A-OK was the verdict and unfortunately not a future destination. :(
author: Kenny L.

description: Best ice cream in the city, great flavors, especially maracuya and guanabana :)
author: Karen P.

description:
Smooth.

Both the delicious smoothie (an acai, pineapple and passion fruit sorbet blend called the Sambo Bit) and the continued brilliant October weather.

One deserves the other.
author: Jason B.

description:
Okay, so I have not come here personally, but my lovely date, with his charm, was able to get the ice cream place's name from a restaurant on the special sea salt mascarpone ice cream with olive oil, which was La Copa Loca, in which he translated it as a crazy cup.

I went crazy on his version of ice cream!

I will for sure come to this place in person and try other kinds!
author: T L.

description:
We hit La Copa Loca third in the Ice Cream Walk of the Damned (Gelato Exception). - 3.5 stars overall

Ice Cream Texture : 4/5.  Tart and sweet or rich and lush.
Flavor Variety : 3/5.  Lots of standard gelato flavors with some tropical additions.  Pumpkin was great.  One star off for offering pints of lucuma and cherimoya but not offering cones of these great flavors.
Customers : Locals, no line up or buskers outside.
Strengths :  Tropical flavors
Cons: Hiding tropical flavors
author: Dave S.

description:
dairy free green apple gelato is Asian semi-lactard Susy C friendly and quite delicious in my book.
perfect way to top off munching on some elotes. (think Nacho Libre)

I had been trying to come here for 2 years, but at night. Each time, I circled endlessly for parking and just as i'd park and rush to the door, they'd close on me =[
Copa Loca, you did not get me this time! I took the BART here during my lunch! MUHAHAHAHAHHAHAHAa

Sooooo glad it's easily accessible by public transportation. I should know better anyway, there's never parking in the Mission!
author: Susy C.

description:
So you're in SF, and you're crazy enough to want ice cream?  In 40 degree weather?  Really?  Ok, I know, we have warm days too... occasionally.  But if you want ice cream, don't bother with second best - if you're in SF, you can get the best gelato available on the West Coast at La Copa Loca.  I know there are other options in SF.  Some of them have been around a long time.  Others are techie (tacky?) and make ice cream with Frankenstein machines.  Whatever.  The point is, how does it taste?  Does it make you want to marry it? 'Cause you will want to marry the gelato here!  Mauro came straight from Italy, with honest-to-goodness Italian gelato machines, and with Italian gelato know-how.  Can't be beat!  If you can't go to Rome, go to La Copa Loca already.  
Btw - naysayers, you're either devoid of taste buds, or on someone's payroll.  Peace out.
author: Lorenzo D.

description: Not bad, nicely underrated. Hazelnut was nothing to write home about. Blood orange had a slightly fake "tang" flavor aftertaste, caramel was yummy, tiramisu not bad. I love getting a sugar cone and walking around window shopping on a warm day in the mission. Sure beats waiting in line for Bi-rite!
author: Naomi K.

description:
A great gelato stop in the otherwise Latino Mission. The coffee is good, the ice cream ... er, gelato ... selection is outstanding. 

The food they offer looks tasty enough, and you won't be disappointed. Its a bit pricey, but I'd say its worth it. If you want budget pastries (which I occasionally do ...) you can get stuff half off at the end of the day, or in the morning. Yum yum.

The staff is nice, to boot. The seating outside is awesome and very Euro in feel. You're on a little side street, so grab a spot in the sun, eat some gelato and drink an espresso while smoking. Oh wait, that's me.
author: Wes T.

description: The gelato was very good only to be surpassed by the service. The young lad behind the counter was genuinely nice. Plus my girlfriend had s a non dairy restriction so this was a perfect fit.
author: Nate S.

description: The only place I found in the Mission district that has delicious Lucuma icecream !!!!
author: Tony L.

description:
I like this place...it's no-nonsense. Order, pay & leave because it's small inside and no room to mill about. But, I'm also a little biased as I lived in Italy for a short time period & can't find any gelato as good as Italy's! 

Pumpkin was my favorite here...and 1 of my faves overall as far as a traditional flavor is judged. 

Fruits of the forest was a good option at that point of our ice-cream crawl, but not something I would order again. It's nice for something on the lighter side with little bits of various fruit mixed in, but nothing to write lots of Yelp reviews about. 

No lines, in fact, I think we created a line b/c we couldn't decide what to order!
author: Marissa H.

description: Tried this place because they have a 50% off Scout Mob. Both my girlfriend and I are now completely addicted to their goat cheese & fig pints and Marscapone soft serve cones. The people who work there are super nice and helpful as well.
author: Tommy G.

description:
Oh how I go loco for La Copa Loca! This place rocks and is dangerously right on the way home from BART. The owner Mario is Italian and this is true gelato, but I like how there's a Mission/Latin twist in terms of flavors. They always change but there are some traditional flavors they have all or most of the the time like pistachio, hazelnut and strachiatella. Though I wouldn't have expected it of me, the yogurt is hands down my favorite. Light, fresh and unbelievably delicious. I haven't had it here yet but love that they make "Spaghetti Ice" - my favorite thing in Europe when I was young. 

Oh yeah, my niece and nephew love that this place is near my house too!
author: Aimee G.

description:
Snarky service and "just OK" gelato. I've had better... just because they "make their own" they don't get an extra star. Yes, the sundaes are creative and cute... for mine the girl had to press the gelato into ridiculous "noodles".  

But at the end of the day I want the girl (or guy) to smile at me and hand me some delicious gelato. 

Neither of those happened.

Nevertheless, I can't ever give edible gelato or ice cream fewer than three stars. I probably won't go back, though. Too many other, better places!
author: Jen F.

description: Varied selection of gelato, though my favorite is the cookies 'n cream. The guy at the counter was really friendly - he saw me struggling between two flavors and offered to give me samples of each. Even though it's been chilly recently, I've still been tempted to get myself a cone!
author: Eve R.

description: I dropped in here one sunny Saturday afternoon needing refreshment and was rewarded with the Tropical Dream smoothie, a gorgeous concoction of coconut milk, banana, pineapple, mango, and vanilla gelato.  Their sorbet and gelato case is truly a thing of beauty, and you are welcome to sample as many flavors as you like (I recommend the kiwi and/or blood orange if they have 'em).  And then take your treat to the tables or bench outside and watch the Mission stroll by.
author: Heidi D.

description: Quite good. Went for the first time with a Scoutmob discount yesterday.  Tried several different flavors and the majority of them were good. There isn't any indoor seating but a couple of tables outside. It was kinda busy as well. I got a smoothie and my daughter got a sundae. Both were quite tasty. We will be going back..
author: Ayana K.

description: Came in here for some gelato.  The place is tiny, just big enough for you to walk in order and leave.  We saw they had pluot gelato which we got excited over because we love Naia's pluot but it wasn't the same :(  Would come back to try other flavors.
